body.name: Silicon Power 2TB NVMe M.2 PCIe Gen3x4 2280 SSD Solid State Drive (SP002TBP34A60M28)

byLineInfo.name: Visit the SP Silicon Power Store

deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Wednesday, February 14. Order within 16 hrs 29 mins
features: PCIe Gen 3x4 interface with read speeds up to 2,200MB/s and write speeds up to 1,600MB/s
The warranty terms on all of its SSDs are based on whether the warranty length or TBW limit occurs first.

To support a Silicon Power PCIe SSD, the system must have an M. 2 connector with only an M key. The Silicon Power PCIe SSD does not have a b notch and therefore, the b key on the SSD connector will prevent it from being inserted
The custom screw should come with the motherboard or PC. Please acquire the screw from your motherboard or PC Manufacturer, if needed
body.description: The P34A60 is an affordable storage solution that doesn't skimp on performance. It's designed for novice users, DIY system builders, purpose-built system manufacturers, and simply those who are looking to upgrade their PC. But with a PCIe Gen3x4 interface, which means four lanes are used for transmitting and receiving data simultaneously, read speeds up to 2,200 MB/s, and write speeds up to 1,600 MB/s, this SSD is anything but basic. (To support a Silicon Power PCIe SSD, the system must have an M. 2 connector with only an M key. The Silicon Power PCIe SSD does not have a b notch and therefore, the b key on the SSD connector will prevent it from being inserted)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Lightning-Fast Storage Upgrade
reviews.reviewText: The Silicon Power NVMe is a game-changer when it comes to storage performance. After upgrading to this SSD, I've experienced a dramatic improvement in speed and responsiveness in my computer, making it a top choice for anyone looking to boost their system's performance.Blazing Fast Speed:The standout feature of this SSD is its exceptional speed. With PCIe Gen3x4 support, it offers lightning-fast data transfer rates. Booting up my computer is now a matter of seconds, and applications load with almost no delay. It's a remarkable upgrade, especially if you're used to traditional hard drives.Ample Capacity:With a generous 1TB of storage capacity, this SSD provides ample space for your operating system, applications, games, and files. It's a perfect choice for those who need both speed and storage without compromising either.Compact M.2 Form Factor:The M.2 form factor means it takes up minimal space in your computer, making it an ideal option for laptops and desktops with limited storage upgrade options. Its slim and compact design fits neatly into compatible slots, keeping your system uncluttered.Easy Installation:Installing the Silicon Power SSD is straightforward. The M.2 design allows for a hassle-free installation process. Once it's in place, you can clone your existing drive or perform a fresh install of your operating system with ease.Reliability and Durability:Silicon Power is known for producing reliable and durable storage solutions, and this SSD is no exception. It's built to withstand heavy use and has a reputation for consistent performance over time.Price:One of the most compelling aspects of this SSD is its affordability. It offers exceptional value for the performance it delivers, making it an excellent choice for budget-conscious users looking to give their computer a significant performance boost.Can't think of any cons.In conclusion, the Silicon Power 1TB NVMe M.2 PCIe SSD (SP001TBP34A60M28) is a must-have for anyone looking to supercharge their computer's performance. Its blazing-fast speed, ample storage capacity, and affordable price make it an unbeatable choice for those seeking a substantial upgrade. Whether you're a gamer, content creator, or simply want a more responsive computer, this SSD delivers in every aspect. It's a five-star storage solution that I wholeheartedly recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fast and affordable NVMe SSD with TLC NAND
reviews.reviewText: I bought this SSD to upgrade my laptop's storage and I'm very happy with the performance and price. It was easy to install and recognized by Windows 10 without any issues. The drive is very fast, especially for sequential reads and writes, and it handles most tasks without slowing down. It also has a black PCB and a 5-year warranty, which are nice bonuses.The only drawbacks are that it doesn't have a software toolbox for monitoring or updating the firmware and that it has lower endurance than some of its competitors. However, these are minor issues for me, as I don't plan to use the drive heavily or for a long time. For the price, this SSD is hard to beat, and I would recommend it to anyone looking for a budget-friendly NVMe SSD with TLC NAND.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Looks professional, well priced
reviews.reviewText: For a M.2 NVMe drive, I like that the packaging is very small & lightweight.It's also a plus that relevant technical info is displayed on the package rather than drawings of racing cars and rockets for example.This shows that the product is also made with power-users in mind thus a simple, clear package print.For the SMART capability it's somehow not seen by all Windows programs, some can get it and some can't.Perhaps the drive must be physically plugged into the real motherboard to get it everywhere (I plugged it into a USB adapter).For the details it's a 512-bytes physical sector size, so it's best to also make sure that your partitions match it (512-bytes chunk/cluster-size), and I don't think that 512-bytes is at all a problem for any M.2 drive anyway.The packaging also says Supports NVMe 1.3, but the drive appears to support the newer NVMe 1.4 as well.So it supports both NVMe 1.3 & NVMe 1.4 (it's still Gen3x4, but NVMe 1.4 itself cans still be used).The drive supports SMART, TRIM & VolatileWriteCache.Another thing worth knowing about is that for another drive model the shipments were sometimes shipped without temperature sensor so a static value was returned always.There were two versions and either of the two were selected at random for shipping.I don't know if it's the case for this NVMe model, but it would be much better to just always ship the temperature sensor-enabled versions always.Otherwise it's hard to know when the drive needs to take a break due to heat (which cans happen while doing I/O-heavy stuff, like mass-copying or intensive random reads for gaming).For the price it's a rare find, this product is priced neutrally, neither too low nor too high.Perfect price-match for getting hold of a 1TB NVMe drive nowadays.More (basic) drive info: Disk geometry: Cylinders: 124519 Tracks/Cylinder: 255 Sectors/Track: 63 Bytes/Sector: 512 Total disk sectors: 0 Logical sector size: 512 Physical sector size: 512 Media rotation rate: N/A Buffer size: N/A ECC size: N/AThe rest wasn't able to be reliably acquired over my USB adapter.However it's worth noting that 'Trusted Computing' is unsupported - good news, it was rather 'anti-user computing' anyway.Therefore this NVMe drive won't agree to work against you for 'trusted' purposes.This product is one the cheaper 1TB NVMe drives, and yet it matches a pretty good quality alike any higher-priced one.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great drive for the price!
reviews.reviewText: Pros:- Great capacity for the price.- NVMe PCIe 3x4 drive rather than SATA- good read speeds- label also serves as alright heat spreaderCons:- Sustained writes will significantly slow down writing speeds

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good quality drive, but the free cloning software 👎
reviews.reviewText: Great drive. Speed test as stated, longevity remains to be seen. Tried their free cloning software (Echo) and that was a complete disappointment. I’m pretty IT savvy and it took a lot of work to figure out it simply wasn’t going to do the job. Several times it rendered my computer unable to boot without first utilizing a recovery disk and some more advanced commands than the average user would likely be comfortable with.TL;DR good drive, use other software to clone your drive.
Great product. Good value for money.
Great performance at affordable price. Reliable brand i just wish they include mounting screw as my laptop doesn't have the screw.
I don't believe this work but very fast pc open windows and other app is very fast opening and processing amazing PC work
Use with external case for ssd. Good speed: write 350mb/s, read 400mb. Some seconds and dvd movie moves to another hard drive. Little bit heat.

reviews.reviewTitle: Stunning improvement to my system - no mounting screw provided
reviews.reviewText: its great, getting promised speed, Absolutely no startup time, just press power it go on, Hope it will work for long. You can identify the difference in Speed of this SSD with my already existing HDD in the Laptop
